1.name: Bell Book and Candle
1.description: A modern-day witch likes her neighbor but despises his fiancée, so she enchants him to love her instead, only to fall in love with him for real.

2.name: Vertigo
2.description: A former police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with a hauntingly beautiful woman.

3.name: The Blob
3.description: An alien lifeform consumes everything in its path as it grows and grows.

4.name: Dracula
4.description: Jonathan Harker begets the ire of Count Dracula after he accepts a job at the vampire's castle under false pretenses, forcing his colleague Dr. Van Helsing to destroy the predatory villain when he targets Harker's loved ones.

5.name: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
5.description: Brick, an alcoholic ex-football player, drinks his days away and resists the affections of his wife, Maggie. His reunion with his father, Big Daddy, who is dying of cancer, jogs a host of memories and revelations for both father and son.

6.name: Touch of Evil
6.description: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping, and police corruption in a Mexican border town.

7.name: The Fly
7.description: A scientist has a horrific accident when he tries to use his newly invented teleportation device.

8.name: South Pacific
8.description: On a South Pacific island during World War II, love blooms between a young nurse and a secretive Frenchman who's being courted for a dangerous military mission.

9.name: Ride a Crooked Trail
9.description: Fugitive bank robber Joe Maybe steals the identity of a marshal and rides into a town whose judge asks Joe to act as town marshal but an old flame almost betrays his real identity forcing Joe to claim she's his wife.

10.name: The Big Country
10.description: A New Englander arrives in the Old West, where he becomes embroiled in a feud between two families over a valuable patch of land.

11.name: Cole Younger, Gunfighter
11.description: Notorious outlaw Cole Younger is the only witness who can clear Kit Caswell of false murder charges leveled against him by jealous rival Jan Merlin who covets Caswell's girl, Abby Dalton.

12.name: The Vikings
12.description: A slave and a Viking prince fight for the love of a captive princess.

13.name: Kakushi-toride no san-akunin
13.description: Lured by gold, two greedy peasants escort a man and woman across enemy lines. However, they do not realize that their companions are actually a princess and her general.

14.name: Damn Yankees
14.description: A frustrated fan of the hopeless Washington Senators makes a pact with the Devil to help the baseball team win the league pennant.

15.name: Gigi
15.description: Weary of the conventions of Parisian society, a rich playboy and a youthful courtesan-in-training enjoy a platonic friendship, but it may not stay platonic for long.

16.name: The Bravados
16.description: A man is chasing four outlaws who killed his wife and finds them in a small town's jail but they escape to Mexico.

17.name: A Night to Remember
17.description: On its maiden voyage in April 1912, the supposedly unsinkable RMS Titanic hits an iceberg in the Atlantic Ocean.

18.name: The Whole Truth
18.description: A movie executive is framed for the murder of his beautiful promiscuous leading lady by her jealous, estranged husband.

19.name: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
19.description: When a princess is shrunken by an evil wizard, Sinbad must undertake a quest to an island of monsters to cure her and prevent a war.

20.name: The Defiant Ones
20.description: Two escaped convicts chained together, white and black, must learn to get along in order to elude capture.

21.name: Mon oncle
21.description: Monsieur Hulot visits the technology-driven world of his sister, brother-in-law, and nephew, but he can't quite fit into the surroundings.

22.name: The Long, Hot Summer
22.description: Accused barn burner and con man Ben Quick arrives in a small Mississippi town and quickly ingratiates himself with its richest family, the Varners.

23.name: Ascenseur pour l'échafaud
23.description: A self-assured businessman murders his employer, the husband of his mistress, which unintentionally provokes an ill-fated chain of events.

24.name: Six-Five Special
24.description: A young singer on a train bound for London finds herself among a group of famous musicians and performers.

25.name: Auntie Mame
25.description: An orphan goes to live with his free-spirited aunt. Conflict ensues when the executor of his father's estate objects to the aunt's lifestyle.

26.name: The Young Lions
26.description: WW2 drama that follows the lives of three young men, one German and two Americans, during wartime.

27.name: King Creole
27.description: A rebellious young man takes a job as a nightclub singer to make ends meet, attracting the attention of a local crime boss.

28.name: Attack of the 50 Foot Woman
28.description: When an abused socialite grows to giant size because of an alien encounter and an aborted murder attempt, she goes after her cheating husband with revenge on her mind.

29.name: Houseboat
29.description: A widower, his three young children, and a bombshell nanny get to know each other better when circumstances have them living together aboard a badly neglected houseboat.

30.name: Teacher's Pet
30.description: A hard-nosed newspaper editor poses as a night school student in order to woo a journalism teacher who cannot stand him.

31.name: Some Came Running
31.description: Dave Hirsch, a writer and an army veteran winds up in his small Indiana hometown, to the dismay of his respectable older brother. He meets and befriends various different characters and tries to figure out what to do with his life.

32.name: Indiscreet
32.description: An actress who has given up on love meets a suave banker and begins a flirtation with him...even though he's already married.

33.name: Separate Tables
33.description: The stories of several people are told as they stay at a seaside hotel in Bournemouth which features dining at "Separate Tables."

34.name: It! The Terror from Beyond Space
34.description: The first manned expedition to Mars is decimated by an unknown life form which stows away on the rescue ship.

35.name: Shadows
35.description: Cassavetes' jazz-scored improvisational film explores interracial friendships and relationships in Beat-Era (1950s) New York City.

36.name: Bonjour tristesse
36.description: Cecile, decadent young girl who lives with her rich playboy father Raymond. When Anne, Raymond's old love interest, comes to Raymond's villa, Cecile is afraid for her way of life.

37.name: I soliti ignoti
37.description: A motley quintet of inept small-time thieves attempt the burglary of a local pawnshop in this Italian farce.

38.name: Queen of Outer Space
38.description: American astronauts are drawn by a mysterious force to the planet Venus, which they find to be inhabited only by beautiful women and their despotic queen.

39.name: Run Silent Run Deep
39.description: A U.S. sub commander, obsessed with sinking a certain Japanese ship, butts heads with his first officer and crew.

40.name: Popiól i diament
40.description: As WWII and the German occupation ends, the Polish resistance and the Russian forces turn on each other in an attempt to take over leadership in Communist Poland.

41.name: The Old Man and the Sea
41.description: An old Cuban fisherman's dry spell is broken when he hooks a gigantic fish that drags him out to sea. Based on Ernest Hemingway's story.

42.name: Rally 'Round the Flag, Boys!
42.description: All about the citizens of Putnam's Landing and their reactions to an army missile base in their back yard.

43.name: Thunder Road
43.description: A veteran comes home from the Korean War to the mountains and takes over the family moonshining business. He has to battle big-city gangsters who are trying to take over the business and the police who are trying to put him in prison.

44.name: Soldaterkammerater
44.description: Every year, thousands of young men are summoned to undergo an education where completely different demands are made than in civilian life. The soldiers must be in perfect physical form and they must learn to deal with modern weapons.

45.name: The Trollenberg Terror
45.description: A series of decapitations on a Swiss mountainside appear to be connected to a mysterious radioactive cloud.

46.name: The Brothers Karamazov
46.description: Drama based on Russian writer Fyodor Dostoevsky's homonymous novel about the proud Karamazov family in 1870s Russia.

47.name: The Revenge of Frankenstein
47.description: Baron Frankenstein escapes from the guillotine and goes to Germany. There, he names himself Dr. Stein and plans to restart his experiments by using parts of dead bodies.

48.name: The Inn of the Sixth Happiness
48.description: All her life Englishwoman Gladys Aylward knew that China was the place where she belonged. Not qualified to be sent there as a missionary, Gladys works as a domestic to earn the money to ...                See full summary »

49.name: Man of the West
49.description: A reformed outlaw becomes stranded after an aborted train robbery with two other passengers and is forced to rejoin his old outlaw band.

50.name: Violent Playground
50.description: Struggle between a Liverpool Juvenile Liaison officer and a young and dangerous pyromaniac.
